Sleep time is less than 7 hours.\10Get enough sleep can help you restore the function and clear body toxins and fatigue. So it is important to keep enough sleep.\10

Fall asleep after 12 o\'clock.\10It is the time for the body to restore its function and rehabilitate after 12 o\'clock in the evening, so try to avoid staying up too late. It is recommended that you fall asleep before 11 o\'clock.\10 \10
Coffee and tea contain stimulants that will have refreshing effects.Avoid drinking it before bedtime (generally don’t drink after 4pm)。\10
Excessive drinking alcohol can make people sleepy, but with poor sleep quality, so avoid drinking too much alcohol 4-6 hours before bed time.。\10
Eating too much food before going to sleep will also increase the burden on the stomach and affect sleep\10
Excessive exercise before going to bed will stimulate excessive secretion of adrenaline, leading to emotional excitement and affect sleep.\10
Work or study with pressure before going to bed may affect the nervous system and hormone balance, easy to get nervous and hard to fall asleep.\10

Keep a good mood, avoid stress;\10 Keep regular schedules; Relax before going to bed, try to listening some light music or nature\'s voice; drink hot milk，\10 Have a foot bath, meditation … before going to bed; Do some exercise and don’t sleep too much during the daytime.\10
How to improve your sleep quality
You can submit feedback about your actual time to help us improve the algorithm so that we can provide more accurate sleep monitor.

The sleep scores were based on duration of sleep and deep sleep and the time to fall asleep.\10 \10 • The best sleeping time is 7 to 10 hours.\10 \10 • The best deep sleeping time makes up 15% to 30% of sleeping time\10 \10 • It is best to fall asleep before 12 o\'clock.\10
Get up time should not be ealier than fall asleep time.
Fall asleep time should not be later than 10:00
Fall asleep time should not be ealier than 18:00 and should not be later than 10:00

BMI index is calculated by dividing the number of kilograms of body weight by the square of the height of the body. It is commonly used to measure the degree of body fatness and reflect whether you are healthy as a standard . The normal range is 18.5 ~ 24.9.

Body fat rate refers to the ratio betwteen body fat weight and total weight, also known as body fat percentage. It reflects the body fat content. The body fat of men and women are not the same in different ages.
Bone mass refers to the content of bone tissue [bone minerals (calcium, phosphorus, etc.] and bone matrix (collagen, protein, inorganic salts, etc.],it can reflect the status of bone health.

The basal metabolic rate refers to the lowest amount of calories consumed during the operation of vital organs of the human body. It shows a gradual downward trend with age. A high basal metabolic rate indicates that your body functions younger and consumes more energy. Conversely, energy consumption decrease reflects the decline of your body function.
Muscle volume refers to the weight of human muscle tissue.It has an important role in improving the basal metabolic rate, protecting internal organs, bones, enhancing cardiovascular function, etc.

Visceral fat level reflects the degree of abdominal visceral fat accumulation. To maintain the standard visceral fat index, can significantly reduce the risk of heart disease, hypertension, hyperlipidemia.

Body water rate refers to the body\'s moisture (including blood, lymph fluid, extracellular fluid, etc.) contrasting with body weight.It can reflect the method of weight loss is correct or not, and the decline of body moisture often leads to the rise of body fat level.
Please confirm the Body of scale

4.Make sure the earphone is turned on and properly worn before reconnect.
To ensure that the device can be searched properly, now jump to the page to open the positioning switch

1.Notifications access－The band/watch can receive push notifications\10 2.Location access－Search and connect the Bluetooth-enabled device\10 3.Contacts and call access－The band/watch can show caller ID and reject a call\10 4.SMS access－The band/watch can receive push messages\10 5.Storage Permissions - Store your health data (sports, sleep, etc.).

Wear the device on your wrist horizontally, about 2 cm to carpal, the same method as wearing watches\10 Note：To monitor heart rate more accurately, please wear the device on the upper position of your wrist and a bit tighter than usual when you are taking exercise.
In the main dial, slide up into the data page, click the arrow to enter the data details. slide up and down to view the data.
In the data page, stay on the heart rate page and heart rate starts measuring.

In the main dial, slide up twice into the sports page and click to enter the sports list. slide up and down to select the type of sport. Press the start button. After the countdown is completed, the sport will begin. During the sport, slide up and down to view the sport data.\10 Click the back button and confirm to exit the exercise and save the data.

In the main dial, slide down to the message page. Click to enter to view the message content. slide up and down to view the message detial. Long press in the message detail page to clear the message.\10 Click Tap the trash can in the left corner of the message page to confirm that the message can be all cleared.

Due to the restriction of the mobile phone system, the app\'s message push function may be unstable, the push service is not running.\10\10 Please complete the following settings , and the message push service can be restored after restarting the phone.
The message push service is not running？

1. After the earphone is turned on, it will enter pairing state. Then you can see that the red and blue indicator light flashes alternately. You will hear the prompt: Pairing.\10\102. Search for the device named Voice18 in the Bluetooth and click to connect.\10\103. Then you will see that the earphone indicator turns blue and flashes. You can hear the prompt: Connected.

Hold the earphone with both hands and wrap the lanyard around the head.\10\10Hang the earloop on your ear while tilting the earphone angle into your ear. Rotate the headphone until it is comfortable to wear.\10\10Note: Try a variety of heart rate sleeves and earbuds to find the right size.

Free ECG AI analysis 15 times per month. Will you continue to view the results?
Note: the above diagnosis is given by the artificial intelligence diagnosis algorithm Cardiolearm, which is for reference only. Please refer to the hospital diagnosis conclusion.
A sinus rhythm is any heart rhythm which originates from the sinus node, it\'s normal rhythm.

The origin of sinus rhythm is same, but the rhythm is irregular, and the variation in P-P interval is >0.12s on the same lead. Sinus arrhythmia often coexists with sinus bradycardia. A more common type of arrhythmia is related to respiratory cycle, called respiratory sinus arrhythmia, most commonly seen in young people and generally without clinical significance. Other sinus arrhythmias which are not linked to the respiration cycle are less common, such as the ventriculophasic sinus arrhythmia associated with ventricular contraction and blood pumping or wandering arrhythmia in sinoatrial node.

Sinus tachycardia is defined as a sinus rhythm with rate that is greater than 100 beats/min (bpm) in an average adult. In the case of sinus tachycardia, the P-R interval, QRS and Q-T duration are correspondingly shortened, sometimes accompanied by mild depression of secondary ST segment and low amplitude T-wave. It is commonly seen in exercise, nervousness, fever, hyperthyroidism, anemia, blood loss, myocarditis, the effect of adrenomimetic drugs and so on.

Sinus bradycardia is defined as a sinus rhythm with rate that is lower than 60 beats/min (bpm). Elderly people and athletes have relatively slow heart rhythms. Sinus bradycardia can be caused by increased intracranial pressure, hypothyroidism, the use of beta-blockers and so on. A sinus rhythm with rate that is lower than 40 beats/min (bpm) is less common.

Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common persistent arrhythmia. The incidence of atrial fibrillation increases with age, reaching up to 10 percent of people over the age of 75. During atrial fibrillation, the frequency of atrial activation reaches 300 to 600 beats/min, and the heart rate is often rapid and irregular, sometimes up to 100 to 160 beats/min, which is not only much faster than the normal heart rate, but also absolutely irregular, and the atrium also loses its effective systolic function. Clinical features:\10 • Palpitation:sensation of a rapid heart beat accompanied by a feeling of weakness or fatigue;\10 • Dizziness:feel light-headedness and even faint;\10 • Chest discomfort:presence of chest pain,a sense of pressure or uneasy feeling;\10 • Shortness of breath: feel hard to breathe during slight physical activity or rest,some patients may not have any symptoms.\10 In atrial fibrillation, the lack of an organized atrial contraction can result in some stagnant blood in the left atrium, which finally lead to thrombus formation. After the thrombus falls off,it will be carried away by the blood circulation to all parts of the body, further leading to cerebral embolism (stroke),limb arterial embolization (severe patients even need amputation),etc.The risk factors for stroke in patients with atrial fibrillation include previous embolic history,hypertension,diabetes,coronary heart disease,heart failure,left atrial enlargement,etc.

It is a kind of rapid ectopic arrhythmia, which occurs in the atria and the impulse frequency is faster than that of atrial tachycardia. The electrocardiogram shows the disappearance of P-wave and the appearance of F-wave with the same size, shape and spacing. Heart rate: 250-350 beats per minute.

Atrial premature complexes, originating in any part of the atrium outside the sinoatrial node. If ECG test is performed in normal adults for 24 hours, about 60 percent of people have atrial premature beats. It can occur in patients with various organic heart diseases and is often a precursor to the atrial tachyarrhythmia.

Before the sinus node impulse reaches the ventricle, the ectopic rhythm of ventricle or interventricular septum sends out the electric impulse in advance, which causes the premature ventricular contraction (PVC). The clinical symptoms are highly variable, ranging from no symptoms, mild palpitation and discomfort, to syncope or blackout caused by malignant ventricular arrhythmia which is triggered by premature beats, and there is no parallel relationship between the clinical symptoms and the prognosis.

Diagnostic significance of high voltage in the left ventricle is unclear, it is more common in left ventricular dilatation or hypertrophy and it\'s an indispensable condition in the diagnosis of left ventricular hypertrophy or dilatation, but it\'s also affected by many factors, such as chest wall hypertrophy, the position of the electrode and so on, and from the above information, it cannot be ruled out of normal ECG physiological performance and a change in the electrophysiology and hemodynamics of cardiac cells caused by long-term excessive alcohol and tobacco. Therefore, the diagnosis of left ventricular hypertrophy must be comprehensively measured and evaluated along with the investigation of medical history, the detection of positive signs, chest X-ray examination, cardiac ultrasound and other auxiliary examinations, as well as the comprehensive evaluation of ECG QRS complexes duration, voltage, morphology, limb lead QRS complexes voltage, electrical axis, ST segment, T-wave, etc., all of which are of vital importance. Therefore, left ventricular hypertrophy cannot be diagnosed only by viewing electrocardiogram RV5+SV1>4.0mV (male) and female RV5+SV1>3.5mV.

Right bundle branch block, RBBB for short, is seen in normal people, but less. It is more commonly seen in children and young adults and incomplete right bundle branch block is more common. Incomplete right bundle branch block is found in about 1% of normal young adults and it can be seen in congenital heart disease, especially in atrial septal defect, also seen in ventricular septal defect with double ventricular dilatation, pulmonary venous malformation, etc. About one-third of patients with rheumatic heart disease with mitral stenosis may suffer. Right bundle branch block itself does not cause obvious hemodynamic abnormality, so it is often asymptomatic clinically. If appear the symptom, it is mainly the symptom of primary disease.

Left bundle branch block, LBBB for short, refers to the delay or block of left bundle branch caused by various reasons, and the impulse spreads first to the RV via the right bundle branch and then to the LV via interventricular septum, resulting in obvious delay of left ventricle impulse, including left bundle branch main trunk block and double block of left anterior forearm and left posterior forearm. The incidence rate is related to age, and the older the age, the higher the rate.
Free ECG AI analysis 15 times per month, you have run out until now, so the analysis results cannot be provided temporarily.
The data cannot be analyzed, please measure again

The shorter the Ground contact time, the longer the displacement time spent in the air, keep the low the Vertical Oscillation and ensuring that the displacement is forward rather than upward, which makes it easier to run faster.
The higher the step frequency, the more weight will be shared in every step, the burden on the leg will smaller.It will reduce the probability of sports injuries.

The Vertical Oscillation shows whether the Soars state is up or forward during running. The effective running mode should be as forward as possible, so the Vertical Oscillation should be kept at a lower range.

Scatter plot:Based on the nonlinear chaos theory, the long range RR interval data were graphically expressed by the fast computing technology, which was used for the diagnosis of heart rate variability and arrhythmia.
Note: Non-medical diagnosis, for reference, please refer to the conclusion of the hospital diagnosis
